abstract: A key that indicates the relative timing of a blood glucose reading to a meal.
overview:
## Discussion

Set this key on a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/bloodGlucose] sample. Set it’s value to an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNumber] object containing a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKBloodGlucoseMealTime] value.Medical professionals can use the relative meal time to help determine the acceptable range for a blood glucose reading. If your app requires more precise timing or additional information about the meal’s composition, create  samples to record those details (for example, a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryCarbohydrates] sample with the exact meal time).

# HKMetadataKeyBloodGlucoseMealTime

**Global Variable**

A key that indicates the relative timing of a blood glucose reading to a meal.

## Declaration

```swift
let HKMetadataKeyBloodGlucoseMealTime: String
```

## Discussion

Set this key on a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/bloodGlucose] sample. Set it’s value to an [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Foundation/NSNumber] object containing a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKBloodGlucoseMealTime] value.Medical professionals can use the relative meal time to help determine the acceptable range for a blood glucose reading. If your app requires more precise timing or additional information about the meal’s composition, create  samples to record those details (for example, a [doc://com.apple.healthkit/documentation/HealthKit/HKQuantityTypeIdentifier/dietaryCarbohydrates] sample with the exact meal time).

## Valid Values

- **HKBloodGlucoseMealTime**: Constants indicating the timing of a blood glucose sample relative to a meal.
